Thanks Jason,

It would really help if you can bring up a new thread.
I tried to figure out what you were trying to convey
by "those". Your inputs on my test code would really
help me to understand better. 

-Srikanth

--- Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...> wrote:
> On Fri, 2004-04-02 at 16:59, mcgqa wrote:
> > Hi,
> > 
> > I have 2 objectives for my testcase below
> > 1) to test the registration process
> > 2) to test the duplicated user
> > 
> > when I run the test, I am getting either a null
> value for loginid or 
> > a totally new in value for dupLoginId and 
> 
> don't know about this, but I do have a comment. 
> Don't initialize those
> variables at init time.  Any shared variable you
> want your tests to
> access should usually go into the setUp() method. 
> In your case it
> doesn't look like it's affecting your test, but for
> future reference
> this habit could cause errors that are very
> difficult to track down --
> eg. static variables in a test.  (If you want more
> info. on this let me
> know and I will start a new thread.)
> 
> > my assertion is failing 
> > when the method testRegisterDuplicatedUser() is
> executed. Can 
> > somebody tell me why?
> 
> You will need to be more specific.  Where is the
> failure?  Is it on the
> first assertion of that method or the second?
> 
> > This is my first post to this forum. Is this the
> right forum to ask 
> > such questions? 
> 
> This is the place.
> 
> -- 
> Jason Rogers
> 
> "Where there is no vision, the people perish..."
> Bible, Proverbs 29:18
> 
>
